name: PiAQ - Open Source Indoor Air Quality Sensor
tagline: Open Source Indoor Air Quality Sensor for Raspberry Pi
body:
# Open Source Indoor Air Quality Sensor An open hardware and software indoor air quality sensor provided by the [National Association of REALTORS](http://realtor.org) and [CRT Labs](https://crtlabs.org). ![CRT Sensor Board](https://github.com/NationalAssociationOfRealtors/IndoorAirQualitySensor/blob/master/media/v0.3_prototype.jpg)

###Measurement Points: Temperature (SHT31) Relative Humidity (SHT31) VOC (Volatile Organic Compounds) (IAQ Core) Derived CO2 (IAQ Core) Barometric Pressure (MPL3115A2) Light Intensity (TSL2561) CO Concentration (MiCS-4154) NO2 Concentration (MiCS-4154) Sound Intensity (ADMP401) Connectivity: FSK (RFM69HW 433/915MHz) WiFi (Particle Photon) Cellular (Particle Electron) (Coming soon) LoRa (Coming Soon) License: Apache License Version 2.0 ### Authors and Contributors In 2016, Akram Ali (@AKstudios), David Conroy (@dconroy), and Christopher Cote (@entone) published initial plans for the PiAQ. ### Support or Contact Having trouble with IAQ? Check out our [faq](https://piaq.io/faq) or [contact CRT Labs](https://crtlabs.org/contact-us/) and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
